intro: Hydrolea spinosa subvar. speciosa, commonly known as the showy hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
